A Collection in
the Library of Virginia 1153850, 1157337, 1157990, 1176219, 1202665

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.physdesc: 5 boxes; 2 boxes found at State Records Center--Archives Annex, Library of Virginia and 3 boxes found at Library of Virginia.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Norfolk County (Va.) Records, circa 1726-1936, undated. Local government records collection, Norfolk County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Five boxes came to the Library of Virginia in a transfer of court records from Chesapeake.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Norfolk County (extinct) was named probably by Adam Thoroughgood, a local resident, for his native county in England. The county was formed from Lower Norfolk County in 1691. Norfolk County became extinct in 1963, when it was consolidated with the city of South Norfolk to form the city of Chesapeake.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Norfolk County (Va.) Records, circa 1726-1936, undated, consist of the following series: Bonds/Commissions/Oaths, Marriage Records and Vital Statistics, Miscellaneous Records, Tax and Fiscal Records, Justice of the Peace Records, Military and Pension Records, Public Buildings and Grounds, County Administrative Records (subfield series include Commissioner of the Revenue Records, Overseers of the Poor Records and Treasurer's Records), Election Records, Organization Records, School Records, Wills, Court Records (subfield series include Judgments, Criminal Records and Clerks' Records) Fiduciary Records, Land Records and Business Records.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Norfolk County Records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult "A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm" found on the Library of Virginia's web site.

scopecontent.p: Bonds, Commissions, Oaths: Various Bonds, 1741-1838; Marriage Records and Vital Statistics: Marriage Articles, Contracts, Settlements, 1827-1837; Miscellaneous Records: Powers of Attorney, 1773-1897; Tax and Fiscal Records: Records, 1782-1890, Receipts, 1793-1837.

Justice of the Peace Records: Summons for Justices, 1821-1850; Bonds/Oaths/Commissions: Oath of Allegiance (1 item), 1848; Military and Pension Records: Officer Qualifications (2 items), 1833 and 1838; Public Buildings and Grounds, 1755-1913; Vital Statistics, Certificates of Death (2 items), 1832; Miscellaneous Records: Resolutions, 1839-1912. Unprocessed/Unarranged.

County Administrative Records: Commissioner of the Revenue Records, Overseers of the Poor Records and Treasurer's Records (1779-1899); Election Records; Military and Pension Records; Miscellaneous Records; Organization Records; School Records and Wills: Unrecorded Wills, n.d., 1809-1905.

Bonds/Commissions/Oaths, 1838; Court Records: Jugments: Ejectments, Criminal Records and Clerks' Records, 1726-1906 (includes plats used as exhibits in the suits, Hudson v. Harding, 1818; March et. al v. Tatem, 1832, Jourdan v. Walker, 1896); Fiduciary Records: Appraisements, Estate Accounts, 1750-1913; Land Records: 1817-1905; Tax and Fiscal Records, 1874.

Tax and Fiscal Records: Inheritance Tax Reports, circa 1915-1930; Bond Accounts, circa 1915 and County Claims, 1752-1771; School Records: Western Branch District School Bonds; circa 1919; Business Records/Corporations/Partnerships: Registrations - Fox Hall Dairy, 1931 and Pine Grove Dairy Farm, 1936; Military and Pension Records: Confederate Pension Records, 1903, 1909, 1915. L01-09-14-02-1
